meanings.definition: The amount that has to be paid or spent to buy or obtain something.
meanings.sent1: The cost of the toy was five dollars.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't afford the cost of the new phone.
meanings.sent3: The cost of admission to the zoo was a bargain for all the fun we had.
meanings.sent4: The cost of success is often hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The cost of neglecting your health can be high in the long run.

meanings.definition: An amount that is given up in order to gain or achieve something.
meanings.sent1: The cost of missing the meeting was a missed opportunity.
meanings.sent2: He was willing to pay any cost to achieve his dream.
meanings.sent3: The cost of skipping breakfast was feeling hungry all morning.
meanings.sent4: The cost of fame can sometimes be loss of privacy.
meanings.sent5: The cost of friendship is often loyalty and trust.

meanings.definition: To require the payment of (a specified sum of money) in order to be bought or obtained.
meanings.sent1: The store will cost you ten dollars for that shirt.
meanings.sent2: It will cost us a lot to repair the car.
meanings.sent3: It would cost a fortune to buy all the books on my wishlist.
meanings.sent4: His mistake could cost him his job.
meanings.sent5: The decision to delay the project could cost us valuable time.
